intro: Zanthorhiza apiifolia var. ternata, commonly known as the three-lobed cowslip, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves with three lobes. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its rhizomatous root system is notable for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. The species is typically found in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, well-drained soils.
